newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France injects 100 mln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France injects 100 mln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France injected 100 million francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Thursday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Friday.
It accepted bids for 38.1 billion francs in new liquidity, 100 million more than the 38.0 billion leaving the market on Friday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on May 30.
The Bank of France said it allocated 11.4 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 3.8 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 26.7 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 10.8 percent of this demand.
